data.title: Out of this world Sushi and Ramen!
data.text: Went here the other night - cozy place nice Japanese style decor. Staff very friendly and inviting too! We start out with the Pork Belly Bun w/ cucumber, pickled onions & scallions it was very delicious. We then had the Tonkotsu Ramen which had rich pork broth w/ pork belly, scallions, bamboo, nori & nitamago egg. I added additional pork belly for another $4. It was very filling and very tasty! Wife also had the california roll which was very fresh as well.

data.title: Good Japanese food
data.text: The panko fried avacado was good, the sushi was average and the ramen was good, but nothing that would bring me back.  Cute little place but too expensive for the flavor of the food.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Found this place on Yelp and im so happy I did. Wanted to eat some sushi and stumbled upon go bistro. The food is amazing. We had the Mufasa roll and the curry Ramen um humm it was good. I will most definitely be coming back with the family.

data.title: No GoBstro
data.text:
We had high expectations that were not met by this restaurant. We were looking for a great Sushi bar in Broward. Other diners seem to have been happy, we disagree.

From our arrival we were surprised that the place does not look as nice in real life as the photos on the restaurant website suggest. The restaurant is more of a street food place as opposed to classy dining establishment.

We started with the grilled calamari appetizer and seaweed salad. The calamari was over cooked, smokey and presented in a way that brought to mind the urban myth of calamari actually being pig rectum. I had to overcome the visual aversion to try to like this dish. The seaweed salad was fair, oily and fishy.

For our main courses we tried various sushi rolls and ramen. I am a big fan of ramen when well done. Mine was not well done. The broth was poorly seasoned. This killed the soup. The noodles were not over done, the veggies were abundant, the added egg was a perfect medium, so that is a positive. The rolls were inconsistent in presentation, quality and taste.

GoBistro does have a nice selection of both hot and chilled sake. Maybe if we drank more before the food arrived we would not have noticed the glaring deficiencies.

I was amused by the ordering and payment system. The credit card was processed at the table on a tablet device. This is reminiscent of the way it is done at restaurants in Europe. It always made me feel more secure to not have my credit card taken away when paying a restaurant tab. This should become the norm and not the exception. In this way, GoBisto was avant-garde. Too bad the food was not.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Came here for dinner with a friend. The sushi was great. I had the eel roll and she had the Japanese bagel roll. We split the curry noodles and they were great ! I would recommend this place for sure !

data.title: FavoriteSpot for Hollywood Sushi and Ramen
data.text: I was introduced to this restaurant by a group of friends. We went at lunch time and the restaurant was not crowded (THANK GOD)! I have been here on multiple occassions for dinner and the place is literally packed every single night. GoBistro has one of the best sushi selections and the sushi always tastes fresh. My favorite menu items are the "Avacado Fries," "Pork Belly Bun," "Tonkotsu," and the "Tuna Crunch Roll." This is a HIGHLY RECOMMENDED place to eat on any occassion. The prices are great, the staff is extra friendly, and the service is beyond fast! This is one of my 2 favorite places to eat on Hollywood Blvd. Side note, whatever is ready first just comes out, you won't get your appetizer first unless you reuqest it.

data.title: A small but busy place
data.text: If you are in these parts then a visit to GoBistro is imperative! The busy-ness,the vibrancy, the amount of food that's being crunched, slurped, the drinks that are being downed all sets a very cool tone to this place. If you arrive at 6 p.m.during the weekend, expect to wait at least 15 minutes to get a table.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Went here based upon reviews and this place did not disappoint. This place is great to order off the menu and share food with your party. We had beef tenderloin, chicken bun, pork gyoza, a 10 piece Mexican roll, fried guacamole, and a salad with ginger dressing. All dishes were delicious! I will definitely come back. The atmosphere is fun and laid back. They close late and the price is right. Good deal!

data.title: Holds us over
data.text: We needed our Asian fix ramen rice it did its job nothing is going to compare to ny but def did the job and would go back again!

data.title: GREAT Ramen find in SoFlo!
data.text: Anyone who has searched for Ramen in South Florida knows that it is near impossible to find... the real thing that is.  There are plenty of imposters.  In fact, since moving back 5 years ago, I had yet to find that authentic Tonkatsu Ramen with the perfectly chewy noodles and flavor that feeds your stomach and your soul.  Well, after finding this gem, I'll look no further for my fix.  With a small price tag, and ALL of the goodness, GoBistro's Tonkatsu is REAL!  I plan to try other things on their menu (because it all is likely absolutely delicious, judging from my first meal), but only after I've had my fill of this amazing ramen.  I plan to be here weekly, and I don't live anywhere near Hollywood beach.  Thank you, Go Bistro, for doing Ramen lovers right!

data.title: Very Underwhelming!
data.text: We planned a staycation in Hollywood for a special occasion 4 weeks in advance. We wanted Japanese food because it is something we don't generally have a chance to eat where we live. I searched this place out on Yelp which it was give 5 stars. We thought wow this must be great. I searched several times because I know the area and I know the food is typically very tourist like. And we wanted a nice place for this occasion. The pictures and reviews all looked like exactly what we wanted. When we walked up we were not sure it was the same place. We said lets give it a try based on everything we saw.  The food was just OK.  The place had a great Sake list. We were very interested in this. Unfortunately the waiter had no knowledge of Sake and could not make a suggestion. He told us the person that knew about sake went home for the night. The basketball games were playing on the two big screens they had in the place. Not really what we had hoped for.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Great place for Sushi and Ramen! We don't have many authentic ramen places and I believe this is one of the best south Florida has offer! I enjoy all the food and the servers are nice too!

data.title: Ramen and other delicious bites.
data.text: We came here to quench my hunger for ramen. It did not disappoint. The restaurant is small and can feel a bit cramped, but don't give up hope for a table. Start off with the avocado sticks, covered in Panko and perfectly fried to a golden brown. Tangy and delicious Ginger soy Gangnam Wings are yummy, oh and the sushi is quite good. Pork belly buns with cucumber, scallions and pickled  onions are also a must. Let's not forget the ramen, with scratch made fragrant and unctuous broth, and topped with egg, pork belly, nori, and oodles of noodles. I made a sad attempt to save some for later, but that didn't work for me, as I slurped down the entire bowl. Save some room for the Donut Tower sprinkled with sweet condensed milk.

data.title: Great food....Just OK service
data.text: The food is great! The ramen soups are phenomenal! The octopus yakitori and pork belly yakitori appetizers were very tasty as well. The place is small and does get busy so they do rush you while eating to sit other tables since space is limited. The servers only go to take your order and then to give you the check. No friendly service at all....

data.title: New place
data.text: I had a big bowl of ramen, with pork belly and a soft egg. The broth was rich and delicious, and the mochi ice cream was interesting. I will definitely go back. Located in lovely downtown Hollywood! I wouldn't recommend the fried avocado.

data.title: Great Ramen
data.text: My husband and I tried this local spot in Hollywood and enjoyed the pork ramen.  The food was delicious, and the service was good.  The restaurant is located in Hollywood with okay parking, and it is casual. Not expensive and  a nice change of pace for lunch. Great find for lunch if you like ramen.

data.title: Great food in Hollywood!!!
data.text:
This place is located in Hollywood with ok parking... I was lucky!!  No valet, and the street is crowded... The place is ok.. Nothing special... Simple and homey... Food is better that I thought! Wakame, average... Avocado fries, quite nice... Over "unhealthy" for my taste, but they arrive so soon that you just eat!!! Did not have sushi, so next time I will rate it... Ramen soup... Looks better than it is... Do not get me wrong, it is good, but could improve in flavor.... Chef, go to work there.... We had the veggie soup!
Place is ok and looks clean... Service quite nice!
Enjoy

data.title: Best Ramen
data.text: Love the fresh sashimi and the pork and curry ramen souo.  This place has consistantly fresh and delicious food.  The service is always friendly and good and the prices are reasonable especially the lunch specials Tues- Fri.

data.title: Good food, bad for solo dining
data.text:
Went there for solo dining, ended up in front of a wall, alone. If I had been at the bar, I guess it would have been better.

Ramen was OK, pork and egg were somehow cold which I didn't like. 

Service was a bit slow, and it's even worse when you're solo dining in front of a wall, but at least food was good. I'm sure it would be a great place for group dining, just not solo.

data.title: If you like good ramen soup, friendly service and a local ambience, this is a great spot to visit.
data.text: My girlfriend and I have been drawn to Go Bistro now for several months. We were going there specifically for their pork belly buns and now we've added they're ramen soup to the list. I was lucky enough to be  surprised with a birthday candle in a sake bottle which the staff was more than happy to bring out and even sing for me. Like most restaurants you end up frequenting more so at first discovery, expect a 1 out of 5 disappointment meal from GoBistro. A definite local spot for some quick & easy, good food and good service. Avocado fries are a must! First time Ive ever seen them.
